title.narrative: 2.1 ACCESS TO BASIC EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2017, girls, boys, adolescents and their families have acquired competencies to participate in the management of inclusive quality education which includes access to water, sanitation and hygiene with focus on adaptation to climate change., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Early Childhood Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Sanitation, Skills Development, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, girls, boys and adolescents in the most disadvantaged conditions, mainly indigenous and afro descendant populations, have enrolled and completed primary education in a timely manner.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, girls, boys, adolescents and their families have acquired competencies to participate in the management of inclusivequality education which includes access to water, sanitation and hygiene with focus on adaptation to climate change.

description.narrative: UNICEF has contributed to strengthening spaces for the participation of children and the educational community in general in order to improve educational quality, supporting strategies aimed at developing learning spaces conducive to generating better educational results. | Status:Met | As-of Date:24/01/2019

title.narrative: National standards for WASH in schools with a disability component available

actual.value: 2018:There is an official document named Norms for WASH in school infrastructure at National Level, by MINED, with UNICEF support, since 2011.

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Availability of a multisectoral budget for WASH in schools (capital and recurrent costs) at the national level

actual.value: 2018:There is no specific budget for WASH in schools as far as public knowledge is concerned.
